results.title: Introducing the new worker to his job
results.creator_credit: United States. Office of Education and Caraval Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Problems in Supervision”.
A new worker is being started in his job; his induction is done poorly, and the worker shows considerable dissatisfaction with his treatment. A demonstration of how a worker should be introduced to his new job is then given.

results.title: Employing blind workers in industry
results.creator_credit: United States. Office of Education and Caravel Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Problems in Supervision”.
It is vitally necessary for the placement-specialist for blind workers to check up on the tyupes of jobs available, and the safety factors of each particular job. When a blind worker is placed in a job, the placement-specialist must see that the job foreman understands the important things to remember when supervising the work of a blind worker, or when explaining a process to them.

results.title: What's the problem?
results.creator_credit: Janet Isaac, Jan Sharp and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Priority Schools series”
Examines the problems found by teachers and students in three different areas where the common denominators are high unemployment, low income and low educational priority by parents.
Suitable for teacher/tertiary level.

results.title: What's the big hurry!
results.creator_credit: Sydney Holden, Peter J Ketchum, Motion Media and Guidance Association
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Priority Schools”.
Uses a comedy about two brothers of different temperaments, presenting in the style of the early silent movies, to contrast the virtue of patience with impatience.

results.title: Stop talking and do something
results.creator_credit: Janet Isaac, Jan Sharp and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Priority Schools”.
A group of teachers in the Sydney suburb of Marrickville discuss the problems they, their students and the students’ families encounter in such an area. These include unemployment, low income, lack of interest in school and cultural differences.

results.title: Book binding
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Printing as a Career”.
Demonstrates book-binding. Pages are machine folded into sections - two types of folding machines are seen in operation; sections are then pressed and the end papers glued. The different sections comprising a book are sewn together; pressing machines round and shoulder the spines which are then glued to receive the cheesecloth; the building in process, in which the shoulders and backs of the books are shaped, is followed by the making and affixing of the cases. After lettering, dust covers are added by hand.
